alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail.

Hazards:
Wind gusts up to 90 km/h.
Nickel to toonie size hail.

When:
This evening.

###

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch ended
alerts.description:
Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms.


###

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Near zero visibility in fog is occurring.

Fog patches near Lake Superior are expected this morning. Conditions are expected to gradually improve through the day.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots, frequent lightning and hail.

Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and track over Lake Nipissing this afternoon and evening. Thunderstorms are expected to be fairly isolated.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.


###

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail.

What:
Wind gusts of 90 km/h.
Hail up to 3 cm. 

When:
Continuing into the afternoon. 

Additional information:
Thunderstorms over northeastern Ontario are expected to strengthen this morning and track over the area, possibly bringing strong winds and hail. These thunderstorms are expected to move east of the area late this afternoon or this evening.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and large hail.

What:
Wind gusts of 100 km/h. 
Hail up to 3 cm.

When:
This afternoon and evening.

Additional information:
Isolated thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and track over the area. These thunderstorms are expected to move east of the area later this evening.

###

Utility outages are possible. Significant damage to property, buildings and trees is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
